sense.name: position, locate, post, put
sense.examples: Buy new windows to place emphasis on accessibility. Place the tray directly on the stove. He was placed on probation In what order would you place these students? The company placed some of their workers in LA. When the state placed me in foster care it was a good thing. In the movie, which event is not accurate for the era in which the movie is placed? Scientists have placed the time of this split between 5 and 7 million years ago. If you are placed in a station that is already full, you will not be accomplishing that goal.

sense.name: Earn a rank in a competition
sense.commentary: Note: Usually followed by an ordinal
sense.examples: Jerry placed third in the marathon. She placed first in the hundred meter hurdles.

sense.name: Identify, establish location or identity
sense.examples: I can't place the face but the name is familiar. A spokesman said it was not possible to place the error.

sense.name: Arrange for
sense.examples: You can place a phone call to Malta using the following steps. How do I place a bet on more than one selection?

sense.name: Finish 2nd in a horse or dog race
sense.examples: He bet two dollars on number six to place.

sense.name: Sing a note with the correct pitch
Make an investment
sense.examples: Place a portion of the money in a mutual fund.

sense.name: Intend something to move toward a certain goal
sense.examples: He placed much criticism on the government.

sense.name: PLACE DOWN-cause to sit; be settled in a position or place
sense.examples: Pick the cup up again, then place it down so the gaff is dislodged. Place the menu down the side of your web pages.

sense.name: PLACE UPRIGHT-put in an vertical position
sense.examples: Place onion upright in shallow bowl and remove center core with circular cutter or apple corer. When you are done coloring the tubes, place them upright in a safe place to dry overnight.
